title: New Message Button Does Not Work On TB v.140.0.1esr Local Folders
content:
[I am starting a new post because I was replying to someone else's post and it stopped working.]

After updating to TB v.140.0esr (then just now updating to v.140.0.1esr) from v.128esr, I cannot compose a new message in any Local Folders or my main virtual inbox. The +New Message button is there, but clicking it does nothing. It was working for over a decade before this.

However, going into the normal account folder inboxes DOES allow me to click the "+New Message" button and start/compose a new message.

I can still reply to messages in the local and virtual folders, just not start a new message.

I have tried disabling all security software. No luck.

I have ran Help > Troubleshoot mode with no addons. No luck.

When I create a new folder under Local Folders, clicking New Message still does nothing while in that new folder. But if I move that new folder to an existing email account, then go to the new folder, clicking New Message works correctly.

I am on Windows 10. I did use the addon Manually Sort Folders in the past, but not recently.

I ran the Check Error Console (ctrl+shift+J) on TB v.140.0esr. Here is the paste:

1752107893534 addons.xpi WARN Checking C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird\distribution\extensions for addons This page is in Quirks Mode. Page layout may be impacted. For Standards Mode use “”. background.html WebExtensions: Import modules with new 'ChromeUtils.importESModule' implementation.js:34 Hello there, I'm BorderColors-D! background.js:11:9 CopySent2Current: 3.39 on Thunderbird 140.0 Received: pong

1.0.9 background.js:141:33 no migration CardBookXULNotifyListener.js:600:13 TypeError: can't access property "document", currentWindow is null implementation.js:568:15 1752107894980 addons.webextension.{a300a000-5e21-4ee0-a115-9ec8f4eaa92b} WARN Loading extension '{a300a000-5e21-4ee0-a115-9ec8f4eaa92b}': Reading manifest: Warning processing locales: An unexpected property was found in the WebExtension manifest. 1752107894980 addons.webextension.{a300a000-5e21-4ee0-a115-9ec8f4eaa92b} WARN Loading extension '{a300a000-5e21-4ee0-a115-9ec8f4eaa92b}': Reading manifest: Warning processing chrome_injectors: An unexpected property was found in the WebExtension manifest. New compose tab 5 with identity id1 styleswitcher.js:31:15 Applying new border style for identity id1 to tab 5 styleswitcher.js:45:13 New compose tab 6 with identity id1 styleswitcher.js:31:15 Applying new border style for identity id1 to tab 6

title: How can I move emails within Thunderbird?
content: How can I move emails within Thunderbird? I want to move emails from the Sent folder of my old email account to the Sent Folder of my current email account. Emails don't move when I right-click on them and select "Move to" and then select the destination folder. All that happens is that the Thunderbird status bar reports: "Looking up pop...." "Connecting to pop..." "Connected to pop..." "Checking mail server capabilities."
creator: leon.arundell

title: Recovering from HDD crash, looking for Thunderbird SENT emails
content:
I'm recovering from a HDD crash that damaged the boot sector only, my files were unharmed. I am/was using Thunderbird. My Roadrunner IN BOUND e-mails were saved on the Roadrunner servers and successfully downloaded to the new Thunderbird client installed on my new hard drive. But none of my SENT e-mails were stored by Roadrunner.

I want to find my old HDD file of SENT e-mails only and move it to my new drive so they'll load in my new Thunderbird. Roadrunner support said they should be on my old HDD but because my old Thunderbird settings were in POP while my new Thunderbird is in IMAP, the file may not be compatible. Of course they gave me incorrect settings also, so not sure if that's accurate.

Regardless, even if incompatible, I want to have some way to access my old sent e-mails for tax and other purposes.

Please help!

Thanks Theo
creator: tchen002

title: Text Menus in Tbird 140
content:
This happens about every three or four major updates: After the programmers monkey with the interface, part of my personalizations disappear. This time, it's the text menus at the top of the screen. (And it's two computers since the last time I had a solution to this.)

The "menu hamburger" is not sufficient for touch-typists. I want the icons off to the right of the text menus, on the same line, the way it's been possible to establish since Tbird was in the low-30s for version numbers. Instead, the update refused to respect my personalizations, and hid the menu bar completely and makes it impossible to combine with the icons. I dimly recall that there was an about:config solution to this in earlier versions, but can't remember or find it (or confirm it would work with Eclipse).
creator: Jaws13

title: Local folder on NAS drive
content: Hi I have a company email account with a large amount of emails accessible from several computers. I created a local folder in Thunderbird on my NAS drive and directed the locations to it on my computers. I have emails sorted by year, as well as received and sent. When I open the program, I can see the email subject, recipient, and date. However, I can't open any of the messages; both the quick preview and the separate window show a white background. What's the problem?

content:

I am frustrated and ready to dump TB but have bee with it many years and don't want to start again with another programme as I am 83 and am partially blind. Please can anyone assist?

title: Trying to recover lost emails.
content:
I have an email account with BlueHost, which also hosts my web domain. A couple weeks ago I stopped receiving emails and contacted BlueHost tech support. The agent had no clue why I wasn't receiving email. She said "Can you please click on acocunt actions and remove the account and re-addd it. [sic]" I did that, and I was again able to receive emails. But then all my old emails -- sent and received -- had disappeared. BlueHost was able to restore my Inbox emails back to May 19, but was not able to recover any Sent emails. I have a backup of my Thunderbird directory from April, but would like to recover all of my old emails, which apparently still exist because my current Thunderbird Profiles directory contains files corresponding to deleted email folders. For example, my Inbox had a subfolder -- call it ABC -- that was deleted and is no longer visible in my Inbox, but I can find files ABC (no extension) and ABC.msf in my Inbox.sbd folder. My Sent.sbd folder also contains files ABC and ABC.msf. These folders are in C:\Users\aaa\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\aaa.default\Mail\mail.aaa.com (with "aaa" representing my personal identifiers). mail.aaa.com contains files Inbox, Inbox.msf, Sent, and Sent.msf, which seem to contain my old emails. (Inbox is 132,151 KB and Sent is 289,829 KB, and the file dates are from a couple weeks ago, when I removed and re-added the email account.)

Is there a way that I can recover the old emails?
creator: kjinnovation

content:

Grazie, Marina

title: Password non salvate/riconosciute all'avvio - problema persistente da mesi
content:
Buongiorno, recentemente all'avvio del programma TB mi vengono richieste tutte e 12 le password delle mail che ho configurato sul profilo. Chiaramente poi vengono richieste alla prima occasione che dalla relativa mail devo spedire qualcosa. Ho controllato eventuali conflitti con l'Antivirus (Avast) ma non ne trovo. Ho provato ad accedere come amministratore ma non funziona.. La versione di TB è la 140.0.1, build 20250709044702, noto che è appena stato installato un aggiornamento ma nei dettagli leggo che non è stato possibile risolvere proprio un problema noto circa le password ma su sistemi 32-bit Mapi.

Queste le caratteristiche del pc: S.O.: Windows 10 64-bit; Processore intelCore i7-4720HQ @2.60 GHz; Ram: 16 GB
creator: amministrazione20

title: How to Convert Excel Files to vCard Formats
content: While manual methods are available, they can be time-consuming and prone to errors—especially with large contact lists. Using a professional Excel to vCard converter tool is the most reliable and time-saving option. The best way to convert Excel data to vCard format is to use a professional converter tool. Let me recommend the Cigati's Excel to vCard Converter Tool that supports multiple Excel files, like spreadsheet documents (.xlsx, .xls, .xlsm, .xlsb, .xltx, .xltm, .xlt, .xlam, .xla), and is also compatible with all versions of Windows. It features to make the conversion fast and effective. It allows users to select the particular sheet from multiple sheets. This tool offers the preview of the selected excel file, so you can ensure the data before converting.

content: Begin augustus stopt mijn email adres hermu024@ziggo.nl. Mijn nieuwe email adres wordt dan hermu024@gmail.com.
